urls.title: Massive oil refinery among worst-performing industrial sites
urls.description: One of the largest industrial installations in the UK had the worst possible permit compliance rating in 2019, according to data released yesterday by the Environment Agency (EA).

text: The UK's 2nd largest refinery, Essar Oil's Stanlow facility, had the worst possible rating of compliance with its environmental permit in 2019. It therefore paid out triple the usual annual fee to the @EnvAgency last year - more than ¬£800k, I reckon. https://t.co/SmXplY0Fne

urls.title: Environment Agency silent on removal of pollution goal from performance report
urls.description: The Environment Agency will not be drawn on why it has dropped a target to reduce the number of pollution incidents from a regular report on its performance against environmental objectives, despite requests for an explanation from ENDS.

RT @RachSalv: This section of the Thames at Teddington Lock has been like this for weeks now. Any plans to rectify the problem and stop it‚Ä¶

@GreenFeltham @CranfordAction @EnvAgency @thameswater @Thames21 If the EA will not clear it then it's the landowners responsibility to do so. Might be worth doing a bit of digging to find out exactly who owns the land and getting in contact with them.

@GreenFeltham @CranfordAction @EnvAgency @thameswater @Thames21 Hi! The Environment Agency will only clear blockages if they are causing a potential flood risk. Though that is A LOT of rubbish, which may well cause the water to back up behind it so it might be worth giving the EA a call on 0800 80 70 60 to report it just in case.
